definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Broad disks of iridescent brightness swam under his lids.
sentences.chinese: 闪亮的彩色光团在他的眼皮底下浮游。

sentences.english: Of course, then you were nearly crushed to death in front of my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 那天，就在我的眼皮底下你差一点儿被车轧死。

sentences.english: The scouts are active under the enemy's very noses.
sentences.chinese: 侦察兵就在敌人眼皮底下活动。

sentences.english: Evolution continues today, and sometimes we can watch it happening.
sentences.chinese: 进化仍在继续，而且有时就在我们眼皮底下发生。

sentences.english: The murderer run away below the police's eyes.
sentences.chinese: 杀人犯从警察眼皮底下跑了。

pinyin: shen2 bu4 zhi1 gui3 bu4 jue2

definition: overt/to make no secret (of one's presence)/grandiose/with great scope
(of a person) honorable/not devious/(of a behavior) fair and aboveboard/without tricks/openly/(of a situation) out in the open

pinyin: ren2 bu4 zhi1 gui3 bu4 jue2

definition: domain/territory under one's control/foundation of a building/base of operations/crust of earth
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to show off one's military strength (idiom); to strut around/to bluff/to bluster
